name: SupportNeimiAndGarcia
_source: speak;Garcia;Don't come near me right now, Neimi!
speak;Neimi;I-I'm sorry!|I was just...wondering what you were doing.
speak;Garcia;I'm preparing myself for the battle.|Please don't come near me right now.
speak;Neimi;Are you trying to get psyched?

speak;Garcia;Yes.|To prepare myself for battle, I visualize the enemy in front of me.|Then, during battle, I can focus all my attention on them.|If you want to survive this war, you must focus all your attention on the enemy.
speak;Garcia;I apologize for yelling at you.
speak;Neimi;That must be how he became such a brilliant warrior!|I must go focus now...
speak;Garcia;That gauntlet!|The one embroidered with the gold falcon...
speak;Neimi;Huh?|Oh, this?|My late grandfather gave it to me.|It was too big for me, so I resized it to fit my hand.|He was the one who taught me how to use a bow...|This is a keepsake he gave me.
speak;Neimi;How in the world...?|Did you know him?

speak;Garcia;Of course.|He was THE master archer.|He was known as “Single-Arrow Zethla.”|He had amazing accuracy and could shoot any target, moving or still, with one shot.|“No second arrow for Zethla” was what people would say.|Renais tried to recruit him many times...
speak;Neimi;Now that I think about it, when Grandpa went hunting, he would take only one arrow with him.|Me, I always took many arrows...
speak;Neimi;He never did join the army, even though recruiters did come by often.|He said that it wasn't in his nature...
speak;Garcia;I know.|In fact, I visited him once when I was young.|He was wearing the gauntlet that day, and it left an impression.
speak;Neimi;I see...|Renais is such a big country, I never would have thought that you knew him.|It's a small world.
speak;Garcia;Indeed.|I can't believe Single-Arrow Zethla's granddaughter is fighting in this war.|I'm encouraged by this fact.|I'm counting on you, Neimi.
speak;Neimi;Um...I'm...happy to hear that.|I-I'll do my best not to let you down!
speak;Garcia;Neimi, I'm sorry if I startled you yesterday.
speak;Neimi;Huh?|Oh, you mean when you were preparing yourself for the battle?|No...|I was just surprised by your...enthusiasm for this war.

speak;Garcia;I used to be like this all the time.|I was always preoccupied with battles, to the point of neglecting my family.|And now, here I am, back on the battlefield.|I'm sure my wife is somewhere sighing.
speak;Neimi;Oh, no, Sir Garcia.|I'm sure your wife understood how you felt.
speak;Garcia;I think it's hard to understand when you are not a soldier.
speak;Neimi;In times like this, you have to fight to stay alive.
speak;Garcia;You've lost family too, didn't you?
speak;Neimi;Yes.|But, I can't keep crying.|I have to be strong and keep going.
speak;Neimi;You quit the army and lived in a mountain village with Ross because Renais was not at war, didn't you?

speak;Neimi;You don't seem to be the type of person who enjoys fighting for its own sake.|I think you know the emptiness and pain of war more than anyone else.|I can see that just by looking at you!|Em...|I'm sorry if I'm being presumptuous.
speak;Garcia;No, Neimi.|Thank you.|You are very perceptive.|You'll make some lucky guy very happy someday.
speak;Garcia;Don't be embarrassed!|Oh, by the way, please take this.
speak;Neimi;What is it?|Oh, this haircomb is lovely!
speak;Garcia;I bought this for my wife when I was still in the Renais army.|But...I never had the chance to give it to her.

speak;Garcia;I buried her with some of the things I'd brought back.|I don't know why, but I couldn't bring myself to bury this, though.|I don't need it.|What would I do with it?|You'd make better use of it.|It will give you a reason to keep using that mirror of yours, too.
speak;Neimi;Sir Garcia!|This is too much!|Thank you!|I will take good care of it!
